title: Splatana Stamper
content:
The Splatana Stamper is a main weapon in Splatoon 3, made by Nouveau.

- 2.1.2 Vertical slash (Holding ZR)

The Splatana Stamper resembles a chainsaw and elongated wheeled date stamp. Inside the metal chassis is a date wheel, attached by a tri-wing screw. The wheel rotates a line of square stamps to form a serrated blade. Each stamp has a square script character; these are written in alphabetical order. At the bottom of the chassis is an embossed square script label resembling a product serial, and attached is a holdable navy ink tank with the Nouveau logo printed on.

The Splatana Stamper was revealed after the Splatoon 3 Direct on 10 August 2022 in promotional images. Nintendo first officially mentioned the weapon in its splatana weapon class Tweet on 12 August 2022. Pressing  allows quick slashes that fire ink, but holding it will charge it for a more powerful slash, which can instantly splat opponents at close range. Its kit consists of Burst Bombs and Zipcaster.

It appears in two missions in Return of the Mammalians:

- 0411 Stamp 'Em Out

- 0601 Bet You Mist Us!

- The Splatana Stamper is a middleweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 16.5. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The Splatana Stamper fires projectiles as it swings.

- The Splatana Stamper can lunge forward if the user performs a charge slash while moving forward on the ground.

- The Splatana Stamper cannot store its charge.

- The ink consumption of 5.2% per slash allows the user to slash 19 times per ink tank.

- After slashing, there is a 40 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- While slashing, the user's speed is set to 0.06 units per frame.

- The projectile of the slash deals 35 damage, and the blade itself deals 20 damage, for a combined total of 55 damage.

- The projectile hitbox consists of 5 smaller hitboxes that become larger the closer they are to the center of the projectile. The center hitbox has a radius of 0.3 units, and the edge hitboxes have a radius of 0.25 units. The hitboxes cover a total width of 2.5 units.

- The projectile travels at 2.82 units per frame for 6 frames and spawns 1.4 units in front of the user, combining for a total distance of 18.62 units.

- The blade hitbox extends about 3.5 units in front of the user, and about 1.6 units to either side of the user.

- The time between continuous slashes is 26 frames.

- The user can submerge in ink 22 frames after the slash starts.

- The blade hitbox appears 6 frames after the slash starts, and the projectile appears 9 frames after the slash starts.

- The ink consumption of 11.7% per slash allows the user to slash 8 times per ink tank.

- After slashing, there is a 40 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- While charging or slashing, the user's speed is set to 0.06 units per frame.

- The projectile of the slash deals 70 damage, and the blade itself deals 140 damage, for a combined total of 210 damage.

- The projectile hitbox consists of 7 smaller hitboxes that become larger the closer they are to the center of the projectile. The center hitbox has a radius of 0.5 units, and the edge hitboxes have a radius of 0.3 units. The hitboxes cover a total height of 3.8 units.

- The projectile travels at 0.8 units per frame for 26 frames and spawns 0.8 units in front of the user, combining for a total distance of 22.1 units.

- The blade hitbox extends about 4 units in front of the user, and about 0.5 units to either side of the user.

- It takes 20 frames to fully charge the weapon.
If the user is out of ink, then it takes 60 frames to fully charge the weapon.

- If the user is out of ink, then it takes 60 frames to fully charge the weapon.

- The swing animation lasts for 22 frames.

- The user can submerge in ink 14 frames after the slash starts.

- The blade hitbox appears 3 frames after the slash starts, and the projectile appears 6 frames after the slash starts.

- Lunges cover a distance of 3.0 units.

- After 3 frames of startup, the lunge lasts for 8 frames. The blade hitbox appears after 15 frames, and the projectile appears after 18 frames.
The total animation lasts for 30 frames, after which the weapon can be used again.
The user can submerge in ink 25 frames after the animation starts.

- The total animation lasts for 30 frames, after which the weapon can be used again.

- The user can submerge in ink 25 frames after the animation starts.

- If the user is out of ink, then it takes 60 frames to fully charge the weapon.

- The total animation lasts for 30 frames, after which the weapon can be used again.

- The user can submerge in ink 25 frames after the animation starts.

[1][2]

- — Fixed an issue where certain control inputs would cause horizontal slashes to be repeated faster than intended.

- ▼ Narrowed the width of ink launched by horizontal slashes by approximately 14%: 2.9 units → 2.5 units.

- ▼ Increased the amount of ink consumed by approximately 30%.
Horizontal slashes: 4% → 5.2%.
Vertical slashes: 9% → 11.7%.

- Horizontal slashes: 4% → 5.2%.

- Vertical slashes: 9% → 11.7%.

- Horizontal slashes: 4% → 5.2%.

- Vertical slashes: 9% → 11.7%.

- ▼ Points to fill special gauge: 200 → 210.

- ▼ Reduced the width of spray droplets created by charged slashes by approximately 10%.

If you're looking for a splatana-type weapon with a bit more OOMPH, look no further than the Splatana Stamper, my friend! Now, this weapon takes a bit longer to charge than the Splatana Wiper, but the trade-off is a wider, more powerful spray of ink. It can really do some damage! Give this a try: fire off a charged slash, and follow it quickly with a horizontal slash or Burst Bombs. Not sure what they call a one-two punch in swordplay, but this is it! And with the Zipcaster special, you're practically buckling swashes! Er, swashBUCKLING. What I mean to say is you're basically a laser space pirate with elite space-pirate tech!

- An Octoling with the Splatana Stamper throwing a Burst Bomb.

For competitive tips about the Splatana Stamper

- The Splatana Stamper's design was inspired by a date stamp provided by Nintendo to developers upon joining.[4]

- When attacking with the Splatana Stamper, the stamps on the wheel rotate. This is especially noticeable when charging it to perform a vertical slash.
